The class II trans-activator ( CIITA ) is a bi - or multi - functional domain protein which plays a critical role in the expression of MHC class II genes .

We report that removal of the N-terminal 151 amino acids , encompassing all of the acidic domain but leaving intact the proline / serine / threonine-rich domain , results in a mutant protein with potent suppressive properties for MHC class II expression .
